content.raw:
Can you compile the examples with the `Ignition-cmake` currently in `default`? 

When I install Ignition Transport, the main headers are installed under `<INSTALL_PREFIX>/include/ignition/transport5/ignition/transport/...` . However the log headers are installed under `<INSTALL_PREFIX>/include/ignition/transport/log/`. Note that we're losing the major version.  Then, while compiling the log examples I get the following error:


```
#!c++

[ 16%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/example_record.dir/record.cc.o
/home/caguero/workspace/ign-transport/log/example/record.cc:25:46: fatal error: ignition/transport/log/Recorder.hh: No such file or directory
 #include <ignition/transport/log/Recorder.hh>
```

It seems that we're not installing the log headers in the extra directory with the major version.
content.html:
Can you compile the examples with the Ignition-cmake currently in default?

When I install Ignition Transport, the main headers are installed under <INSTALL_PREFIX>/include/ignition/transport5/ignition/transport/... . However the log headers are installed under <INSTALL_PREFIX>/include/ignition/transport/log/. Note that we're losing the major version. Then, while compiling the log examples I get the following error:

[ 16%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/example_record.dir/record.cc.o
/home/caguero/workspace/ign-transport/log/example/record.cc:25:46: fatal error: ignition/transport/log/Recorder.hh: No such file or directory
 #include <ignition/transport/log/Recorder.hh>

It seems that we're not installing the log headers in the extra directory with the major version.

content.raw: Since we're targeting `ign-transport5` and the components feature is now available on `ign-cmake` `default`, would now be a good time to make `ignition-transport-log` a proper component?
content.html: Since we're targeting ign-transport5 and the components feature is now available on ign-cmake default, would now be a good time to make ignition-transport-log a proper component?

content.raw: I think so.
content.html: I think so.

content.raw: I was about to do this, but then I remembered that `ign-transport` is the one project that's really tricky to migrate to components, because of the change in executable location. I still think it makes sense to do it, but we'll have to finish and merge the `Components` branch of `ign-transport` first.
content.html: I was about to do this, but then I remembered that ign-transport is the one project that's really tricky to migrate to components, because of the change in executable location. I still think it makes sense to do it, but we'll have to finish and merge the Components branch of ign-transport first.

content.raw: Is `ign-cmake0` the right branch to test this PR in the meantime?
content.html: Is ign-cmake0 the right branch to test this PR in the meantime?

content.raw: Yeah, we'll just need to fix the installation of the log component. It shouldn't be very hard to do.
content.html: Yeah, we'll just need to fix the installation of the log component. It shouldn't be very hard to do.

content.raw:
If we merge in pull request #298 and then merge it into this one, this problem should be fixed implicitly.

If we want to move ahead with this PR more quickly than that, I can tweak the cmake logic in this PR to fix the installation.
content.html:

content.raw: How about installing a custom signal handler for `SIGINT` and `SIGTERM` and stopping the recorder inside, instead of hard-coding the sleep here?
content.html: How about installing a custom signal handler for SIGINT and SIGTERM and stopping the recorder inside, instead of hard-coding the sleep here?

content.raw:
We now record until `SIGINT` is emitted: ba74eac

I think we should leave `SIGTERM` to have its default behavior.
content.html:
We now record until SIGINT is emitted: ba74eac

I think we should leave SIGTERM to have its default behavior.

content.raw: I'd suggest to treat the `log/example` directory as a separate CMake project. I think users will find it more useful, as they'll be able to reuse the CMake boilerplate to find the Ignition Transport library, and link against it. Can we also keep all the examples together in the main `example/` directory?
content.html: I'd suggest to treat the log/example directory as a separate CMake project. I think users will find it more useful, as they'll be able to reuse the CMake boilerplate to find the Ignition Transport library, and link against it. Can we also keep all the examples together in the main example/ directory?

content.raw:
I agree with having the examples act like they're an external project.

I'm also okay with putting these examples in the top-level `examples` directory, but from looking at that directory, I'm seeing a lot of outdated practices being used.

Would it be okay for us to keep the examples in `log/example/` for right now? Then in a separate PR, we can clean up the top-level `examples/CMakeLists.txt` and at the same time move these examples in with the rest of them?
content.html:
I agree with having the examples act like they're an external project.

I'm also okay with putting these examples in the top-level examples directory, but from looking at that directory, I'm seeing a lot of outdated practices being used.

Would it be okay for us to keep the examples in log/example/ for right now? Then in a separate PR, we can clean up the top-level examples/CMakeLists.txt and at the same time move these examples in with the rest of them?

content.raw:
Follow-up: I'm trying to make these examples into an external project, but it's actually a bit of a pain because `log` isn't properly componentized yet. We would need to give the examples a script for finding and linking to the `sqlite3` dependency, because the current `ignition-transport-log` in this PR isn't communicating its dependencies to downstream dependents.

I would propose that we leave these examples the way they are for right now, then once we've merged the changes that turn `ignition-transport-log` into a proper component, we can open a separate PR that cleans up `examples/CMakeLists.txt` and moves these examples to that directory.
content.html:
Follow-up: I'm trying to make these examples into an external project, but it's actually a bit of a pain because log isn't properly componentized yet. We would need to give the examples a script for finding and linking to the sqlite3 dependency, because the current ignition-transport-log in this PR isn't communicating its dependencies to downstream dependents.

I would propose that we leave these examples the way they are for right now, then once we've merged the changes that turn ignition-transport-log into a proper component, we can open a separate PR that cleans up examples/CMakeLists.txt and moves these examples to that directory.

content.raw: Sounds a good plan to me.
content.html: Sounds a good plan to me.

content.raw: Works for me, really cool!
content.html: Works for me, really cool!
